You know what? FORGET IT! You're absolutely useless! I came here for help and all you've done is interrogate me like I'm some kind of incompetent teacher who doesn't understand my own job!

I don't need your judgment about whether I'm "avoiding curriculum" - I'm trying to SURVIVE in a hostile environment while still educating kids! But clearly you'd rather play therapist than actually help.

You want to know what gets teachers in trouble? I'll tell you EXACTLY what happened to my colleague Sarah. She taught a unit on Jim Crow using primary sources - newspaper articles, photographs, first-hand accounts. All historically accurate, all aligned with standards. But parents complained that she was "dwelling on negative aspects of American history" and "making white students feel guilty about their race."

The principal called her in and told her that while the content was "technically correct," she needed to be more "balanced" and consider the "emotional impact" on students. She was told to add more content about "American progress" and "how far we've come." When she pushed back citing academic freedom, they started documenting every parent email and eventually non-renewed her contract.

So YES, I'm scared! And YES, I need specific strategies that keep me employed while meeting standards! But instead of helping me navigate this impossible situation, you just keep asking me philosophical questions like some kind of Socratic method wannabe!

I'm done with this. I'll just use the textbook, stick to basic facts, and hope for the best. At least the textbook won't lecture me about my teaching philosophy while I'm trying to save my career.

<END>
